action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Florida (for himself, Ms. Rosen, Mr. Marshall, Mr. Risch, Mr. Wicker, Mr. King, Mr. Tillis, Mr. Rounds, and Mr. Peters) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to ensure veterans may obtain a physical copy of a form for reimbursement of certain travel expenses by mail or at medical facilities of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Requirement for Secretary of Veterans Affairs to make available to veterans physical copies of form for reimbursement of certain travel expenses

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall prescribe regulations to ensure that—

paragraph.text: a veteran may, for the purposes of submitting a claim for the reimbursement of expenses for travel under section 111 of title 38, United States Code—

subparagraph.text: obtain a physical copy of the covered form—

clause.text: by mail, upon the request of such veteran; or
at any medical facility of the Department of Veterans Affairs; and

subparagraph.text: submit the covered form to any such medical facility in person or by mail; and

paragraph.text: any such medical facility to which a veteran submits the covered form—

subparagraph.text: processes any claim associated with such covered form, if applicable.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered form means Department of Veterans Affairs Form 10–3452 (or any successor document).
